Package squidpony.squidai.astar

extends Object

  • Field Details

    • MANHATTAN

      public static final Heuristic<Coord> MANHATTAN
      A predefined Heuristic for Coord nodes in a 2D plane where diagonal movement is estimated as costing twice as much as orthogonal movement. This is a good choice for graphs where only four-way movement is used.

    • CHEBYSHEV

      public static final Heuristic<Coord> CHEBYSHEV
      A predefined Heuristic for Coord nodes in a 2D plane where diagonal movement is estimated as costing the same as orthogonal movement. This is only suggested for graphs where eight-way movement is used, and it may produce erratic paths compared to EUCLIDEAN.

    • EUCLIDEAN

      public static final Heuristic<Coord> EUCLIDEAN
      A predefined Heuristic for Coord nodes in a 2D plane where all movement is calculated "as-the-crow-flies," using the standard Pythagorean formula for distance as in the real world. This does not make diagonal connections, if they are allowed, actually cost more or less, but they won't be preferred if an orthogonal route can be taken. This is recommended for graphs where eight-way movement is used.

    • DIJKSTRA

      public static final Heuristic<Coord> DIJKSTRA
      A predefined Heuristic for Coord nodes in a 2D plane where the heuristic is not used, and all cells are considered equivalent regardless of actual distance.

    • HEURISTICS

      public static final List<Heuristic<Coord>> HEURISTICS

    • positions

      public Arrangement<Coord> positions

    • allConnections

      public ArrayList<List<Connection<Coord>>> allConnections

    • width

      public int width

    • height

      public int height

  • Constructor Details

    • DefaultGraph

      public DefaultGraph()
      Creates an empty DefaultGraph with capacity 16; you must call init(char[][], boolean) or otherwise manually initialize this DefaultGraph before using it. The capacity is expected to resize to fit a typically-much-larger map.

    • DefaultGraph

      public DefaultGraph​(int capacity)
      Creates an empty DefaultGraph with the given minimum capacity; you must call init(char[][], boolean) or otherwise manually initialize this DefaultGraph before using it.
      Parameters:
      capacity - how many nodes, approximately, to expect in the map

    • DefaultGraph

      public DefaultGraph​(char[][] map)
      Creates a DefaultGraph and immediately initializes it using init(char[][], boolean), with eightWay set to false (only orthogonal neighbors will be connected).
      Parameters:
      map - a char[][] where # is used to mean a wall or an impassable cell

    • DefaultGraph

      public DefaultGraph​(char[][] map, boolean eightWay)
      Creates a DefaultGraph and immediately initializes it using init(char[][], boolean).
      Parameters:
      map - a char[][] where # is used to mean a wall or an impassable cell
      eightWay - if true, this will try to connect diagonals as well as orthogonally adjacent cells

  • Method Details

    • init

      public void init​(char[][] map, boolean eightWay)
      Initializes or resets the nodes this knows about and their connections to their neighbors. This can be called more than once on a DefaultGraph, typically when the map changes, and will forget its old nodes and only store the ones in the latest map. The map should use # for walls and impassable areas; all other chars will be considered equally passable.
      Parameters:
      map - a char[][] where # is used to mean a wall or an impassable cell
      eightWay - if true, this will try to connect diagonals as well as orthogonally adjacent cells

    • getConnections

      public List<Connection<Coord>> getConnections​(Coord fromNode)
      Returns the connections outgoing from the given node.
      Specified by:
      getConnections in interface Graph<Coord>
      Parameters:
      fromNode - the node whose outgoing connections will be returned
      Returns:
      the array of connections outgoing from the given node.
